attributes.action: Allow Muslims Public Call of Prayers During the Holy Month of Ramadan
attributes.additional_details: Ramadan is the holy month in the religion of Islam. It is a month of repentance, forgiveness, and change. Muslims come closer to ALLAH (God) by obeying his command of fasting and are reminded every year of the importance of giving alms to charities and taking steps to easing poverty and alleviating its causes around the world. The Public Call of Prayer (Athan) is an integral part of the Islamic faith which acts as a reminder to its followers of the daily five prayers. Ramadan Mubarak.
attributes.background: We want the Government to allow Muslims public call of prayers during the holy month of Ramadan.

rejection.details:
We cannot accept petitions requesting specific rights for people of a particular religion, but we have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Give religious institutions legal rights to broadcast calls to prayer: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/574283
